Why Lodging in a Private Accommodation?
To Know Cuba, to Live Cuba!!

Lodging in a casa particular can be one of the most interesting experiences you can enjoy during your trip to Cuba. Aside from having the chance to meet travelers from around the world you will know the Cuban reality from within, living with a Cuban familiy. Another important argument is the price. Casas particulares are the most economical option for your stay in Cuba.

Have you ever felt your time wasn´t enough to knowing everything that you wanted? Getting the most from vacation days could be difficult if we don´t know the chances of our travel destination. However, it could turn so simple as choosing the right travel package. The most popular destinations of the Caribbean Island, car rent options, the hospitality of the Cuban families in private homes, salsa, rum, cigars. From Cuba where the happiness of living is true.

They can´t miss in luggage your travel documents, a camera and a swimsuit.
To Cuba, you can´t come without a swimsuit!

In general the weather in Cuba is hot and humid most of the time, so bring cool and light clothing items. Perhaps in Cuba you need a light jacket because you will often find air-conditioned places. Cubans are used to that, but it might bother tourists.

The sun in Cuba is particularly strong, so a (+50) sun-protection lotion will be essential. On the other hand, if you are planning to visit some rural areas, near the coast or where there is abundant vegetation, it will be very useful to bring insect repellents.

Say good bye to your regular contacts and let them know you will be away some days on vacation. When you come to Cuba, you should be aware of the fact you will be off line for a few days. Internet service in Cuba is expensive and not fast at all, so you’d better postpone all your internet stuff for your return.

Probably, one of the first things you experience in Cuba will be an encounter with some tourist hustlers, who are known in Cuba as “Jineteros”. Those people (Men and women) will make you believe they have the best deals on restaurants, transportation, accommodation, and tours, etc. Day after day, their main occupation is to persuade foreigners to accept their offers and most of the time those who are persuaded have ended up being swindled.

The best thing to do in these cases is not to pay attention to these offers because they are not really more economical. Prices for foreigners in Cuba are pretty standardized. The cases of services and items that are significantly more economical are because they are illegal. Do not contribute with the increase of these non-desirable events in our country.
Help us to develop a responsible tourism.
Refuse any of these offers from the very beginning and avoid any conversation with them, otherwise they will go on insisting by appealing to numberless arguments.
Trust the choices you have made via the internet, or the ones you made after having read the experiences of other travellers, or after having consulted Cuba travel guides.
Do not risk the peace and quietness of your trip.

One more thing you should be aware of is money exchange. Never do that in the street. There are many state-run places called “Cadeca” (Exchange bureaus) where you can change your currency into CUC (Cuban Convertible Currency), or you can also do it at any bank.

And finally, one last important warning that has to do with water. The weather in Cuba is very humid. So it is important that you keep your body hydrated, but drink preferably bottled water, which is the safest thing to do in order to take care of your health.

You will receive the invoice with the payment details via email. The total amount must be paid within the 30 days next. For late bookings the amount be paid immediately. The travel documents (vouchers) with all the prices paid will be sent via e-mail.

A mobile application that facilitates the owner the management at their accommodation facilities by means of a calendar that shows the days not available for accommodation, and updates the availability of their rooms directly on our web site.

Connect to the internet on your mobile with operating system Android 2.2 or above and download the application from this address: https://mycasaparticular.com/en/apprenta or directly from Google Play. After having downloaded it, install your application.

In order to start using MYCasa Renta, you will need to activate your access account. The instructions for the activation have been sent to you via e-mail. If you haven’t received this information yet, in which the details of the creation of your access account have been specified, you can request it through info@mycasaparticular.com.

Once the mobile application has been installed on your telephone, and the process of activation of your account has finished successfully, you will be able to start using MYCasa Renta. On the welcome screen of the app, you should press the button Submit.In order to start using MYCasa Renta, you should authenticate by using as user the code of your house, received in the e-mail of creation of the access account. The password to be used is the one set by you in the activation form.

This application consist of an interactive calendar to modify the state of the different rooms of your property. Each room will show the dates registered as “Not available” at the moment of authentication. The first time you use this application, you should have access to the internet so that the data of your accommodation facility can be synchronized with the ones saved on our system.
